perturbation.original_text: MUTUTAL RELEASE: With the exception of Licensee's Royalties payment obligations with respect to all Wireless Products released as of the date of this Amendment, and the obligations set forth in this Amendment, neither party shall have any further obligation under the Agreement, and all claims arising under the Agreement shall be mutually released.
perturbation.changed_text: MUTUTAL RELEASE: With the exception of Licensee's Royalties payment obligations with respect to all Wireless Products released as of the date of this Amendment, and the obligations set forth in this Amendment, neither party shall have any further obligation under the Agreement, and all claims arising under the Agreement shall be mutually released. This release specifically includes any warranty claims, express or implied, related to the Wireless Products.
perturbation.explanation: By adding 'This release specifically includes any warranty claims, express or implied, related to the Wireless Products,' the amendment seeks to waive implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose, which are consumer rights protected under the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) as adopted by most states in the U.S. This omission introduces legal risk as such waivers must be conspicuous and unambiguous, and the added sentence might not meet that standard, potentially violating consumer protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Implied Warranty Laws

perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall develop and distribute the following Wireless Products in connection with the property "ICE AGE 2": (i) 1 Java Game; (ii) 1 Java Application ('Screensaver') where feasible; (iii) up to 5 MMS; (iv) up to 10 Wallpapers; (v) and up to 5 Voicetones ("ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products") in each of the following five (5) languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, with Portuguese, Greek, Dutch and Swedish to be made available where practicable. Licensee shall have the non-exclusive right and license to develop and distribute ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products during the Term of the Agreement for all Wireless Products set forth in this Paragraph 2(c) except the Game, for which Licensee shall have the exclusive right and license to develop and distribute until December 31, 2006.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall develop and distribute the following Wireless Products in connection with the property "ICE AGE 2": (i) 1 Java Game; (ii) 1 Java Application ('Screensaver') where feasible; (iii) up to 5 MMS; (iv) up to 10 Wallpapers; (v) and up to 5 Voicetones ("ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products"). Licensee shall have the non-exclusive right and license to develop and distribute ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products during the Term of the Agreement for all Wireless Products set forth in this Paragraph 2(c) except the Game, for which Licensee shall have the exclusive right and license to develop and distribute until December 31, 2006.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mentions that the Wireless Products will be in five languages: English, French, German, Italian, and Spanish and additional languages 'where practicable'. By removing this, the contract does not explicitly guarantee availability in these languages. This could violate consumer protection laws in regions where those languages are prevalent, as consumers might expect the products to be localized. Also, it is misleading advertisement as it is not clarified in the agreement what is to be expected by the consumer.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Protection Laws Regarding Misleading Advertising and Product Localization

perturbation.explanation: The removal of specific dollar amounts for the 'Guarantee Forfeiture Payment' and 'additional minimum recoupable guarantee' introduces ambiguity and potential for dispute. This violates principles of contract law requiring clear and definite terms, and potentially runs afoul of consumer protection laws if the ambiguity disadvantages the licensee. If the original agreement contains some consumer rights or benefits tied to the guarantee amounts (e.g., royalty calculations), omitting these amounts effectively removes transparency and potentially violates fair dealing requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Principles of Definiteness and Clarity; Consumer Protection Laws - Fair Dealing
